oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pieces of clay pipe
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Clay pipe stem fragment and bowl found on Stumphouse Mountain in 1937 in Walhalla, S.C. Bowl which has "Fillmore" on one side and "President" on the other. It was found by David Lowry Stoddard who was working for the Civilian Conservation Corps.; Carolina. Archaeologists dispute whether these pipes were of German or American manufacture.
